title: The ratio of the ages of a and b is 9:4 three years ago the ratio of their ages was 3:1, what is their present age? - Quora

response.answer_text: We will not follow any long method, the approach which i am putting in front of you guys let you do it orally. Given ratios: 9:4 & 3:1 Multiply 9:4 with difference of 3 and 1 ie 2 & Multiply 3:1 with difference of 9 and 4 ie 5. [math]{9:4}×2 =》18:8[/math] [math]{3:1}×5 =》15:5[/math] Now, difference of 18 and 15 or 8 and 5 is 3. Take 3R= no of years ago 3R=3=》R=1 Present ages : 18R and 8R ie 18×1 and 8×1 ie 18 and 8

Ratio of the ages of A and B = 9:4 Let the age of A is 9x Then age of B is 4x Age of A three years back = 9x - 3 Age of B three years back = 4x - 3 Therefore (9x - 3):(4x -3) :: 3:1 So, (9x -3) = 3 (4x -3) 9x -3 = 12x -9 3x = 6 or. x =2 So present age of A = 18 and B = 8
